text: And I disagree that you don't need version managers. It is very practical to be able to handle which version of Julia is used by which project with just a couple of command line commands.

text: You _can_ install multiple versions of Julia by hand, and they'll happily live side by side, but then you have to handle it all manually, creating alias over alias to run the right version at the right moment. With asdf everything's handled automatically, from installation to running the right version in the right place, without having to create aliases or going through weird hoops
